items.value: Techniques that estimate and mitigate errors without fully correcting.
Aim to isolate the quantum system from its environment, reducing the impact of external noise.
By applying sequences of carefully timed pulses, the quantum system's evolution can be decoupled from its surroundings, minimizing errors caused by environmental interactions.
Manipulating the system's Hamiltonian to suppress certain types of errors.
Adjusting the parameters to make it less sensitive to specific error sources, thereby reducing the likelihood of errors during computation.
